intro: Blackstonia serotina f. aestiva, commonly known as the late blooming form of the blackstonia serotina, is a rare and unique variant of the blackstonia serotina. It is a deciduous shrub native to the eastern United States, typically found in moist, acidic soils in woodland habitats. The plant is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its foliage consists of alternate, simple, and serrated leaves that are dark green in color. This botanical variant is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting local wildlife.
